abstract: Study in Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences finds malaria, once endemic in Europe, likely followed migrations of people from India to Europe and then from Europe to the Americas; findings are based on DNA from samples collected by Dr Ildefonso Canicio in Spain in 1920s.

headline.main: In Decades-Old Slides, Drops of Blood and Hints of Malaria’s Path

keywords.value: Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences
keywords.name: organizations

snippet: DNA studies help reveal that some malaria strains closely followed the migrations of people: from India to Europe and then from Europe to the Americas....
lead_paragraph: DNA studies help reveal that some malaria strains closely followed the migrations of people: from India to Europe and then from Europe to the Americas.
